story.text: Jan 3 Uniform and protective clothing maker UniFirst Corp. (UNF.N) reported first-quarter earnings above Wall Street estimates, driven by 10.5 percent revenue growth in its core laundry business, sending its shares to a new year high. The stock touched $43.95, topping the previous peak of $41.63, which it had reached on Dec. 4, 2006. J.P. Morgan Securities, which has an "overweight" rating on the stock, said it continues to expect strong earnings per share growth from UniFirst in fiscal 2007 due in part to robust internally generated growth and lower energy comparisons. It said in a research report that the stock is "attractively valued", trading at 16.3 times its fiscal 2007 EPS estimate. The Wilmington, Mass.-based company said its specialty garments segment posted a 28.1 percent rise in revenue in the first quarter from the year ago period. The segment's customers include government and nuclear cleanup projects. The company earned 71 cents a share on revenue of $222.4 million. For details, please click on [ID:nWNAS6607] For the first quarter, four analysts on average had expected the company to earn 65 cents a share, before any exceptional items, on revenue of $216.2 million, according to Reuters Estimates. Shares of the company were up 13.46 percent at $43.58 on the New York Stock Exchange in midday trade. (Reporting by Sankalp Saini in Bangalore)
story.title: update 1 - unifirst shares at new year high , q1 beats estimates
